evidence.text:
Person B: She said she spoke to him! To Daniel.
Person B: No! I’m trying him again.
Person A: I’m getting in the car. Let me know what you hear.

Person B: Drinking hard liquor can make you depressed. You know Wendy Horowitz’ son got hooked on Don Julio. He’s been in and out of rehabs, he can’t hold a job. He’s got no sense of agency. He is totally lost. And he may never find himself...
Person A: Is there anything that can be done? A database of some kind?
Person B: We’ve lost our moral center as a society. This is a systemic problem.
Person A: This wouldn’t have happened a year ago. She’s not as self-reliant as she was.

Person B: I didn’t ask. I assume it was.
Person B: Ugh, she’d never forgive me.
Person A: We could consider full time care but it’s expensive.
Person B: I just want what’s best for her.
Person A: She just can’t hear me--
Person B: Don’t say that.

Person A: ...I don’t like sushi.
Person A: I don’t--
Person B: You go for the environment.
Person B: She can chew some things, Alan.

Person A: I think she actually has a brain tumor now.
Person A: Yeah, the doctors said it was growing so slowly we could just leave it.
Person A: It was a few years ago. She got very disoriented. She didn’t know who she was, who we were. It passed after about an hour but it was... unsettling.
Person A: Wouldn’t it be in your wallet?

Person A: Do you recognize anything?
Person B: Can you make it bigger. Can you enhance it?
Person B: Isn’t there a gas station on Tujunga and something?
Person A: This is the speed limit. We’re a law abiding family.
Person B: Marci Wender’s husband was obsessed with Waze. He took a psycho left and ended up inside a Vons. They had to pay thousands of dollars--
Person B: Technology is what got us into this mess! Can you go back?

Person A: You have to ignore all of your instincts and trust the technology--
Person A: I can’t go back.

Person A: Ugh, it added two minutes!
Person B: There’s still cars.

Person A: Just to consider the options here, could this be another TGA?
Person A: Her behavior is erratic. It seems within the realm of possibility. I’m going to google it.
Person A: It’s in the past... why didn’t you?
Person B: Duration of no more than 24 hours--

Person A: We’ve all lost her before.
Person A: Especially if she has the cart. She’s always been like that - once she sets her mind to something...
Person A: I’d like to go, Alan--
Person B: Enjoy your walk, sweetheart. Love you.
Person B: Daniel?!
